page.title: 17THELWALL VIADUCT
page.content: The Thelwall Viaduct carves its way through the areas, bringing noise and mayhem to the quiet countryside as the communters, businessmen and lorries hurtle up and down one of the busiest stretches of motorway in the country to the industrial regions of the North and the Midlands. The weekend caravaners and summer holidaymakers wind their way North to the Lake District or Blackpool or South to Devon and Cornwall. The Viaduct was opened in l963 and arches upwards over the River Mersey for 2 miles. The rush hour traffic blocks the three lanes and more often than not there are miles of tailbacks. The Viaduct seems to sprout "cones" regularly closing at least one lane or two. Accidents frequently occur as in the winter fog is common.
